message.content:
I'll calculate the requested financial ratios step by step using the three financial statements provided.

## 1. Current Ratio
Current Ratio = Total Current Assets / Total Current Liabilities
Current Ratio = $21,224,639.20 / $727,140.68 = 29.19

## 2. Gross Profit Margin
Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%
Gross Profit Margin = ($4,142,813.42 / $14,542,813.42) × 100% = 28.49%

## 3. Debt to Asset Ratio
Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets
Debt to Asset Ratio = $727,140.68 / $29,133,140.32 = 0.02

## 4. Net Profit Margin
Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%
Net Profit Margin = ($405,999.64 / $14,542,813.42) × 100% = 2.79%

## 5. Cash to Current Debt Ratio
Cash to Current Debt Ratio = (Cash on Hand + Bank Deposits) / Total Current Liabilities
Cash to Current Debt Ratio = ($1,482,632.85 + $1,100,000.00) / $727,140.68 = 3.55

## 6. Free Cash Flow (FCF)
From the cash flow statement, we can see the Net Increase (which represents FCF) is -$17,417,367.15

## 7. Return on Assets (ROA)
ROA = (Net Profit / Total Assets) × 100%
ROA = ($405,999.64 / $29,133,140.32) × 100% = 1.39%

```json
{"solution": {'Current Ratio': '29.19', 'Gross Profit Margin': '28.49%', 'Debt to Asset Ratio': '0.02', 'Net Profit Margin': '2.79%', 'Cash to Current Debt Ratio': '3.55', 'Free Cash Flow (FCF)': '-17417367.15', 'Return on Assets (ROA)': '1.39%'} }
```
